byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and CHRIS BUCKLEY

abstract: Three-day visit by Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi to China, touted by both he and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping as primarily a business trip, presents India with opportunity to strengthen economic partnership with its largest neighbor; Modi is faced, however, with task of balancing pursuit of economic goals while asserting India's security interests in light of history of territorial disputes between the two nations.
lead_paragraph: A three-day visit to China by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been promoted as a business trip padded with displays of good will and ancient cultural kinship.

headline.main: Narendra Modi and Xi Jinping Aim to Shelve Rifts Amid Economic Courtship
headline.print_headline: India and China Aim to Shelve Territorial Rifts Amid Economic Courtship

snippet: A three-day visit to China by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been promoted as a business trip padded with displays of good will and ancient cultural kinship.
